Title: Volkswagen
Sentence: In Germany, the company Hanomag mass-produced the Hanomag 2/2/10 PS "Kommissbrot", a small, cheap rear-engined car, from 1925 to 1928.In 1934, with many of the above projects still in development or early stages of production, Adolf Hitler became involved, ordering the production of a basic vehicle capable of transporting two adults and three children at It soon became apparent that private industry could not turn out a car for only RM990.

Title: Volkswagen
Sentence: One of the first foreigners to drive a Volkswagen was the American war correspondent Ernie Pyle, who had the use of a captured Volkswagen for a few days after the Allied victory in Tunisia in May 1943.Pyle, Ernie, Here Is Your War, Cleveland, World Publishing Company, Forum Books edition, 1945, pp. 275, 293.

Title: Volkswagen
Sentence: In 1956, Volkswagen began by building a plant in So Bernardo do Campo, near So Paulo as its first manufacturing plant outside Germany as a response to the Brazil's ban on the import of completely assembled vehicles in 1950.The importance of the Brazilian market gave birth to several models developed and manufactured by Volkswagen do Brasil, which include the Fox, Gol, Nivus, Saveiro, Virtus and Voyage.

Title: Volkswagen
Sentence: CEO use of pun on Nazi sloganIn 2019, during an internal event with hundreds of managers, the CEO, Herbert Diess, repeatedly said "Ebit macht frei", ('Earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation,EBIT will set you free'; EBIT is an acronym for "earnings before interest and taxes") a pun on "Arbeit macht frei", ('work will set you free'), a slogan that famously appeared above Nazi Germany's Auschwitz concentration camp.
